answers.answer: Go back to your doctor and ask for a swab to be taken of the bad areas of your skin.  The swab is then sent to a laboratory to be analysed.Unfortunately, if this is a fungal infection (which it highly likely is) you would need to be taking the Introconazole antifungal capsules for a few months as well as a Canesten spray and a oil spray called Emollin.It can take many weeks to months of the treatment for it to settle.The other thing is ask your doctor to send you to have a glucose test.  If ou have glucose intolerance, pre diabetes or diabetes, these skin issues can fester.  If you have bee on antibiotics these skin problems can be encouraged.Buy a large container as much as you can afford of Epsom Salts.  Bathe every day with 2-3 large cups full of Epsom Salts in the bath water.  Add some baby oil or coconut oil into the bath water because Epsom Salts is very drying to the skin.  Soak in the water for 10 or more minutes.  The Epsom Salts changes the pH level of your skin which the bugs don't like.Do NOT use any soap, bath or shower gels.  This will aggravate your condition even more.Wear cotton pants and don't wear manmade fabric and nylon ones.  This will make you sweat more and encourage the aggravation on your skin.Don't wear tights and tight trousers.  At home don't wear anything under your skirt to let the air to your skin.Your doctor can prescribe Dermol 600 which is a anti microbial bath solution that you pour into the bath.  I use this with the Epsom Salts and the baby oil, sometimes coconut oil.  Don't put too much any of the oils in, otherwise you will end up slipping and sliding.Whilst waiting for an appointment to see your doctor, as a home remedy you can apply natural set yogurt to your private areas after you have washed these with water and gently dried.  The yogurt helps by cooling down the irritation and the itching and also helps to bring down the inflammation and swelling.When you have sex, use latex free condoms as you may have an allergy to latex.Anal itching can sometimes be from thread worms so do look at your faeces to see if there are any thin thread like worms.  Sometimes you won't see any, but may still have them.  They come out at night time to lay their eggs on the anus and cause a lot of itching.  If you have been scratching this can then aggravate things.As much as everything is itching, try not to scratch.  Scratching will damage your skin and thicken.For moisturising,  you can try virgin coconut oil.  Coconut oil has antibacterial and antifungal properties.  It can be eaten, used for cooking and baking, used on the skin.  It is the only oil that does not change its composition when heated.Another home remedy is to bathe in a handful or 2 or plain porridge oats.  No, the oats do not block up the plug hole.You need a cream to kill off whatever bugs you have on it, as well as moisturise it every day.Wishing you a speedy recovery.Best wishes.

question: I've had itching on my vulva and creases between thighs and vulva, and all inside my bum cheeks and the actual anal hole and the perineum between vulva and anus, this has been going on since about last summer, but it's gotten a lot worse since this January.
